hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Mujahid: Regarding the verse "And We took from them a covenant most strong" (Surah Al-Ahzab 33:7), he said: He took from them the covenant more severely than what He took from all the Prophets, meaning from those who were named in this verse.

narrators.name: Abd al-Rahman
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn al-Husayn ibn Muhammad ibn Ja'far
narrators.alternative_names: Muhammad ibn al-Husayn al-Shaybani, Abu al-Fath al-Shaybani

narrators.name: Ibrahim
narrators.full_name: Ibrahim ibn Fahd ibn Hakim ibn Ibrahim ibn Qudamah ibn Mahan
narrators.alternative_names: Ibrahim ibn Fahd al-Basri, Abu Ishaq al-Saji

narrators.name: Ibn Abi Nujayh
narrators.alternative_names: Abdullah ibn Abi Nujayh, Shafi ibn Matia
narrators.kunya: Abu Uthman, Abu Sahl, Abu Ubaid

chainIssues: Transmission shifts from direct terms (نا) to indirect terms (عَنِ/عَنْ) with Ibn Abi Nujayh and Mujahid
Ibn Abi Nujayh is a known mudallis (category 3) using عَنِ which requires verification of direct connection
This is a mawquf hadith (stopped at Mujahid, not reaching the Prophet ﷺ)

potential_issues.issue: First narrator Abd al-Rahman is completely unknown (majhul al-ayn)
potential_issues.impact: Severely affects chain reliability as the hadith depends on this unknown narrator for collection

potential_issues.issue: Second narrator Ibrahim ibn Fahd is unknown with no documented reliability grade
potential_issues.impact: Adds another unknown element to the chain which weakens it further

potential_issues.issue: Ibn Abi Nujayh (Abdullah) is a known mudallis using عَنِ transmission term
potential_issues.impact: While Ibn Abi Nujayh is considered Saduq (acceptable), his mudallis status combined with indirect transmission to Mujahid requires verification of actual meeting

potential_issues.issue: The hadith is mawquf (stopped) at Mujahid and does not reach the Prophet ﷺ
potential_issues.impact: This is a tafsir interpretation rather than a prophetic hadith, classified as mawquf

Topics: Quranic interpretation of surah Al-Ahzab verse 7

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Mujahid: Regarding the verse "So that He may question the truthful about their truth" (Surah Al-Ahzab 33:8), he said: Meaning those who conveyed and delivered from the Messengers.

narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn al-Husayn ibn Muhammad ibn Ja'far

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Mujahid: Regarding the verse "When there came to you armies" (Surah Al-Ahzab 33:9), he said: The confederates were: Uyaynah ibn Badr, Abu Sufyan ibn Harb, and Qurayza.

Topics: Quranic interpretation of surah Al-Ahzab verse 9
Identification of the confederates at the Battle of the Trench
Names of the armies mentioned in the Quran

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Mujahid: Regarding the verses "When there came to you from above you" and "and from below you" (Surah Al-Ahzab 33:9-10), he said: Meaning the wind of As-Saba (the eastern wind), which was sent upon the confederates on the day of the Trench until it overturned their cooking pots upon their mouths and tore away their tents until it expelled them. And the verse "and troops whom you could not see" (Surah Al-Ahzab 33:9), meaning the angels. He said: And the angels did not fight on that day.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Mujahid: Regarding the verse "When the hypocrites and those in whose hearts is a disease were saying..." (Surah Al-Ahzab 33:12), he said: They spoke to them with hypocrisy at that time, and spoke to the believers with truth and faith, saying: "This is what Allah and His Messenger promised us."
